page.title: 02Villages and Hamlets
page.content: {Hillesley}is well named as there are plenty of hills around. In the Domesday Book of 1086 the village was named HILEAHE. The village can be quite self sufficient with a bakery and grocers shop, Post Office, Radio and T.V. shop, garage, public house, restaurant, church, chapel and primary school. There are about 125 houses and 5 farms in and around the village. {Alderley}is a small village without any shops. there was an old manor house which is now a private school. There are about 21 houses, a letter box in a wall and a church. About half a mile down the road is a trout farm. A celebrity who used to live in the village was Marion North, who painted flowers of many countries. Her work can be seen at Kew Gardens, London.
